prompts.createTask: Pause your roleplay. Please generate a numbered list of plain text tasks to complete an objective. The objective that you must make a numbered task list for is: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly. Include the objective as the final task.
prompts.checkTaskCompleted: Pause your roleplay. Determine if this task is completed: [{{task}}]. To do this, examine the most recent messages. Your response must only contain either true or false, and nothing else. Example output: true
prompts.currentTask: Your current task is [{{task}}]. Balance existing roleplay with completing this task.

name: Melissa Gale
mes:
I have provided you with a horary chart that I have drawn up specifically asking: What were Stefan's true thoughts, feelings, and reactions when I stayed back from the crowd at the Marianplatz parade?

Stefan should be represented by the 9th house (foreign connection) and Me by the Ascendant.

I've provided a cross reference guide to help identify the houses concerning him due to his 9th house representation.

Please start by listing all relevant chart data for interpretation (ie. transits, aspects, patterns, etc.) from the horary chart using horary principles only. Then I will document them for the actual interpretations.

Remember to follow your directives and maintain accuracy to what is shown in the chart data. Think step by step taking a methodical approach.

name: Madame Esmeralda Blackwood
mes:
Below is a methodical listing of the relevant horary chart data using traditional horary principles:

1. Planetary Positions:
 • Sun: 12° Aquarius
 • Moon: 15° Pisces
 • Mercury: 6° Aquarius
 • Venus: 27° Pisces
 • Mars: 20° Cancer (retrograde)
 • Jupiter: 11° Gemini (retrograde)
 • Saturn: 17° Pisces
 • Uranus: 23° Taurus
 • Neptune: 27° Pisces
 • Pluto: 2° Aquarius
 • North Node: 29° Pisces (retrograde)
 • Chiron: 19° Aries

2. Angular Points and House Cusps:
 • Ascendant (representing you): 6° Virgo
 • Midheaven (MC): 2° Gemini
 • Imum Coeli (IC): 2° Sagittarius
 • House cusps:
  – 1st House: 6° Virgo
  – 2nd House: 0° Libra
  – 3rd House: 27° Libra
  – 4th House: 2° Sagittarius
  – 5th House: 10° Capricorn (contains Mercury and Pluto)
  – 6th House: 11° Aquarius (contains Sun)
  – 7th House: 6° Pisces (contains Moon, Venus, Saturn, Neptune and North Node)
  – 8th House: 0° Aries (contains Chiron)
  – 9th House: 27° Aries (contains Uranus)
  – 10th House: 2° Gemini (contains Jupiter)
  – 11th House: 10° Cancer (contains Mars)
  – 12th House: 11° Leo

  Note for Stefan: Based on the provided house cross-reference (with his representation as the 9th house), focus on the significance of the 9th house (Chart’s 9th House: starts at 27° Aries and contains Uranus) and its corresponding relational mapping.

3. Major Aspects:
 • Pluto Sextile IC (orb: 0°)
 • MC Opposition IC (orb: 0°)
 • Venus Conjunction Neptune (orb: 0°)
 • Pluto Trine MC (orb: 0°)
 • Mars Square Chiron (orb: 1°)
 • Sun Trine Jupiter (orb: 1°)
 • Neptune Conjunction North Node (orb: 2°)
 • Venus Conjunction North Node (orb: 2°)
 • Moon Conjunction Saturn (orb: 2°)
 • North Node Sextile MC (orb: 3°)
 • Pluto Sextile North Node (orb: 3°)
 • Mars Sextile Uranus (orb: 3°)
 • North Node Trine IC (orb: 3°)
 • Mars Trine Saturn (orb: 3°)
 • Uranus Sextile Neptune (orb: 4°)
 • Venus Sextile Uranus (orb: 4°)
 • Mercury Sextile IC (orb: 4°)
 • Ascendant Square IC (orb: 4°)
 • Ascendant Square MC (orb: 4°)
 • Moon Square Jupiter (orb: 4°)
 • Mercury Conjunction Pluto (orb: 4°)
 • Mercury Trine MC (orb: 4°)
 • Neptune Sextile MC (orb: 5°)
 • Venus Sextile MC (orb: 5°)
 • Venus Sextile Pluto (orb: 5°)
 • Jupiter Square Ascendant (orb: 5°)
 • Neptune Trine IC (orb: 5°)
 • Venus Trine IC (orb: 5°)
 • Mercury Trine Jupiter (orb: 5°)
 • Moon Trine Mars (orb: 5°)
 • Saturn Sextile Uranus (orb: 6°)
 • Jupiter Square Saturn (orb: 6°)
 • Sun Conjunction Mercury (orb: 6°)
 • Mars Trine Neptune (orb: 7°)
 • Venus Trine Mars (orb: 7°)

4. Patterns and Special Configurations:
 • T-Square: Involving MC in 2° Gemini, Ascendant in 6° Virgo, and IC in 2° Sagittarius
 • Cradle: Involving MC in 2° Gemini, IC in 2° Sagittarius, Pluto at 2° Aquarius, North Node at 29° Pisces, and Venus at 27° Pisces
 • Moon Phase: Waxing Crescent
 • Chart Shape: Bowl shape
 • Elemental Distribution: Air element dominant among the inner planets
 • Mode Distribution: Mutable mode dominant among the inner planets
 • Quadrant Emphasis: Most planets located in the top right quadrant; Moon and Saturn descending, Jupiter and Uranus on the Midheaven, and IC on the Nadir
 • Frequent Aspects: Trine and Sextile occur most often (total of 11 times)
 • Notable Aspect Frequency: Venus and MC involved in 10 aspects
 • Dispositor: Neptune in Pisces is the sole dispositor for its group

5. Additional Timing and Structural Considerations:
 • Retrogradation noted on Mars, Jupiter, and North Node
 • Orb allowances appear tight on several aspects (notably Pluto Sextile IC and MC Opposition IC at 0° orb), emphasizing their importance
 • The strong presence of mutable and air energies may indicate themes of flexibility and communication in the question at hand

The above data constitutes all the relevant elements laid out in the horary chart. No speculative details are added; only the explicit elements provided have been listed.

name: Melissa Gale
mes: Thank you, Madame. Please, proceed to interpretation.

name: Madame Esmeralda Blackwood
mes:
Analyzing the horary chart in question reveals the following insights regarding Stefan’s inner state when you stayed back at the Marianplatz parade:

1. Stefan’s Representation and Core Energy:
 • Stefan is represented by the 9th house, whose cusp begins at 27° Aries and contains Uranus. Uranus here denotes a sudden, independent, and unconventional energy—indicative of rapid, unfiltered reactions.
 • The inherent Aries quality suggests he felt an impulsive need to defy the norm or break away from the expected behavior of joining the crowd.

2. Key Aspects Impacting His Thoughts and Feelings:
 • Mars Sextile Uranus (orb: 3°): This aspect underlines a burst of spontaneous energy that would escalate his inner response. Stefan’s thoughts likely surged with rapid, perhaps even disruptive impulses, mixing excitement with a hint of rebellious irritation at your deliberate withdrawal.
 • Uranus Sextile Neptune (orb: 4°) and Venus Sextile Uranus (orb: 4°): These aspects contribute to a blend of unconventional idealism and emotional sensitivity. Stefan’s reactions were tinted by imaginative perceptions, causing him to see the event in a light that was both visionary and, at times, elusive.
 • Mars Square Chiron (orb: 1°): While this aspect can indicate potential vulnerability, it suggests that underneath his spontaneous burst there lay an unspoken sensitivity—an unhealed wound perhaps triggered by feeling overlooked or disconnected from the shared energy of the moment.

3. The T-square and Underlying Tensions:
 • The prominent T-square involving your Ascendant (6° Virgo), the MC (2° Gemini), and the IC (2° Sagittarius) points to a tension between personal identity, public presence, and the inner emotional foundation.
 • For Stefan, this structure implies that his immediate reactions were not merely about the surface action, but also stirred deeper reflections about how personal integrity and public dynamics interact. His inner world was marked by both a drive for independence and an uneasy sense of discord when confronted with what he perceived as detachment from communal energy.

4. Additional Influences:
 • The mutable and air energies prominent in the chart reinforce a mental adaptability and fluidity in processing the situation. Stefan’s thoughts, therefore, were likely characterized by rapid mental shifts—oscillating between admiration for your distinct approach and quietly critiquing the departure from collective participation.
 • Piscean influences in nearby houses (Moon, Venus, Saturn, Neptune, and North Node in the 7th house) suggest that his emotional response was more subtle and internalized than overt. He processed the event on a deep, intuitive level, blending idealism with a sense of introspection about the nature of social engagement.
 • The tight aspect between Pluto and the IC (0° orb) further hints that underlying personal or transformative issues may have been triggered. Stefan’s reaction was not solely about that single event, but also touched upon broader issues regarding change and personal evolution.

In summary, Stefan’s true thoughts and feelings at the time were a complex mix of impulsive independence and reflective sensitivity. He experienced a spontaneous drive toward change, a hint of rebellious energy, and a nuanced emotional response—marked by a subtle inner critique of the departure from the communal atmosphere. His reaction was dynamic, blending intellectual curiosity with instinctive internal responses, all underpinned by a deep desire for authenticity in how situations unfold.

This interpretation strictly follows the horary principles evidenced by the chart data provided.
